tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: The story of a brother and sister longing to carry out their dying mothers wish for them to find their brother, and a son whose life is on hold until his birthmother is a part of it.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.sub-title: 1981: Spike Milligan, Harry Secombe, Barry Tuckwell, Gough Whitlam
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson interviews guests Spike Milligan, Harry Secombe, Barry Tuckwell and Gough Whitlam.

A company allegedly used monitoring software to turn its staffs computers into listening devices. The government plan to tackle South Australias devastating algal bloom. Plus Sarah Ferguson interviews musician Teddy Swims.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: This week on The Pacific we look at Palaus feral monkey problem, and how Frances political turmoil is wreaking havoc half-way across the world. We also announce the winner of this years Pacific Break music competition.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Melissa Mackay brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Locked out of Melbournes soaring housing market, Matt and Kate move to Tasmania to build two Earthships with no building experience.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The roadshow returns to one of Waless grandest houses, Powis Castle. (Final)

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Tom Gleeson takes four contestants through their paces to find the Hard Quiz Champ. Benedict Cumberbatch expert Dave, Led Zeppelin expert Paul, US Geography expert Kelly and One Direction expert Velvet all play HARD!

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Lush Rainforest Garden and Growing Hops
programme.desc: Costa explores a lush rainforest garden, Josh discovers a huge epiphyte collection, Jerry visits a subtropical hops farm, Tammy gets creative with indoor plants, and we meet an artist who has crafted a vibrant sanctuary.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Its the Battle of the Duds! Fan favourites Pru (expert subject: knitting), Sarah (the Kray twins), Cameron (Spider-Man) and James (Breaker Morant) get one more crack at taking home Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug!

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Hosted by veteran ABC journalist, Leigh Sales, this week The Assembly sees the Autistic journalism students interview Australian entertainment royalty, Julia Morris.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Nikkis crisis deepens as she becomes more entwined with the deadly Ndrangheta.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Professor T
programme.desc: An artisan baker is found dead after receiving death threats. Is it a case of revenge or is the killer closer to home? Professor T uses his criminological insight to help the police identify the murderer.

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Hosted by veteran ABC journalist, Leigh Sales, this week The Assembly sees the Autistic journalism students interview Australian entertainment royalty, Julia Morris.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: Black Saturday Bushfires. Saturday 7 February 2009. I Was Actually There collects personal stories from survivors, first responders and community members who faced the catastrophe.

programme.title: Return To Paradise
programme.desc: Three hairdressers return from lunch to find their boss, Bianca Bailey, has been killed. The method is strangulation, but the murder weapon remains a mystery that Mackenzie is determined to untangle.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Lost In Random and How To Tackle Tough Games
programme.desc: We roll the dice on the dark fairy tale adventure of Lost In Random, plus DARREN dishes out some more tips on how to tackle tough games!

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: In order to abide by the clothing policy of their favourite Boba shop, the Bears get some new outfits. But with new looks come new lives including office work, fashion modeling and even falling in love!

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: As Marinette thinks about her future, a supervillain shows up in Paris. Able to force people to live their childhood dreams, he turns into a nightmare for our heroes.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Beast Boy falls for Terra.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its bath time for a reluctant Timmy. In trying to escape, Timmy gets a spring attached to his tail. Its up to the flock to catch the bouncing baby sheep and return him to the tub before he destroys the farm.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Robin tries to destroy some pesky mocking birds.

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: In this show, the former holiday camp Bluecoats dare to flip two of the House Robots with their launcher Apollo. Engineering students have created a future tech machine that uses mecanum motion to move in any direction.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve takes a special journey to meet the most trafficked animal on earth - the pangolin. He meets the people working tirelessly to save them.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Valiant Hercule, Work A Miracle! A Challenge From Outer Space
programme.desc: With Beerus gone and the world at peace once more, the Z Fighters resume their normal lives. But nothing ever remains calm, as aliens arrive on Earth to thank and challenge the hero who fought Beerus.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Warioware: Get It Together! and Get Your Grown-ups Gaming!
programme.desc: We check out the mischievous micro-games of WarioWare: Get It Together, and recommend some great games to get your grown-ups into gaming!

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: While trying to sail to Japan, the Baby Bears get stranded on an island. Luckily, they meet Dave and Karla, who help with survival on the island while working for an escape.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres a snake in the lab as Dr Chris and Dr Xand explore how our body temperature works, and we bust some urban myths about how to stay healthy with new twin doctors Dan and Raph.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The Titans revert to creative game-play to beat the supervillain dodgeball team.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Hard Quiz Kids
programme.sub-title: Star Trek, Pitch Perfect, Christiano Ronaldo and Nevermoor
programme.desc: Four brave kids step into the Hard Quiz Kids spotlight for a chance to win Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug. Tonights expert topics: Star Trek, Pitch Perfect, Christiano Ronaldo and Nevermoor!

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: Ava asks Janine to help her teach the after-school step class, but they dont agree on how to run the program.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: Our heroes meet twin Trainers who have won 15 Tag Battles in a row and the boys challenge Ash and Dawn to battle number 16!

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: Breakneck comedy show packed with stand-up routines from top comics, brought to life in sketch form. Featuring Jack Skipper, Tadiwa Mahlunge and Lindsey Santoro.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Operation Ouch! 3D cinema is open! But how do you see the world in three dimensions? Find out as the Doctors reveal the incredible eye muscles that control how you focus on things close-up and far away.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Fred gets a call for help from his daredevil of a best friend, leading the gang on a rescue mission deep in the caverns of an ancient civilization.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Ant and Fontaine realise their grandparents found Lemuria before them! But where are they now? The Nektons follow the trail they left but run into predatory giant Sand Strikers! Was this the fate of their grandparents?

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Miraculous Mini Golfer
programme.desc: Convinced a customer is cheating to claim a prize, Charlie hires the Inbestigators to help save his job at the Mini Golf Park.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: When Buttercup tests into Honors Math, she tries to avoid being labeled a nerd.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: When a flying saucer crash-lands, F makes a new friend who is a long way from home. This episode introduces the letter F and the words fog, fun, fin and fan.

programme.title: The Writers Workshop
programme.desc: Understanding different genres - the structure and style, tone and mood, and how a particular text conforms to or challenges the generic conventions, helps us to analyse the text and draw out themes.

programme.title: Lets Dance
programme.desc: Learn a disco-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: We find out about youth-led protests in Madagascar, which have led to a military takeover.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Three months without an offer on Junes latest pad has stalled her moving ways. Phil comes to the aid of June who has a pink house, excessive floral flock wallpaper and troublesome trinkets.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: They took his money. They took his wife. And they tried to take his life. Now its time for payback as one man starts his own personal war against the syndicate in this hard-edged thriller.

programme.title: rage Vault Guest Programmer: System Of A Down
programme.desc: Filmed while the band toured Australia with the 2002 Big Day Out, join Shavo and John from System Of A Down as they guest program rage.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway?
programme.desc: Aisha Tyler hosts the legendary improv show featuring regulars Wayne Brady, Ryan Stiles and Colin Mochrie along with guest performer Brad Sherwood.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Herman the mantis shrimp is in the lab to help the doctors explain how your incredible body not only makes crystals in your bones and teeth, but also stops them from doing damage in your kidneys.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Despite Velmas strong dislike of water, the Gang climb aboard the cruise ship run by Freds cousin. But a water phobia is the least of their problems when a terrifying Sea Monster attacks the ship!

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Ant searches a deep chasm for clues to his grandparents fate. He stunned to find Mad Madeline there! Shes been looking for the biggest sunken treasure ever! But all shes managed to find is the biggest monster!

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The Titans search for pirate treasure to save the Tower.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Going down in the elevator of death and, Jamie and Adam take wing in a levitation machine build off.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.sub-title: Mr. Onion Is Ready To Help!
programme.desc: Mr Onion uses the Bumparoller to rescue his best friend, moving a big log out of the way, and to squash a bump in the road. Mr Onion is always ready to help!

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: When Beep finds a lonely fuzzle, she decides to take it in as a pet. To take good care of her new friend, Beep and Mort start fuzzle watching to learn more about Mollyvales smallest inhabitants.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Mimi is unaware she has broken some old eggs in her apron pocket and wonders what is making such a terrible smell. She asks her friends to help find where the smell is coming from.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Recording in the woods, the Sound Collector hears something very special.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: During Bings bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and its too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Suzy Sheep has come to play with Peppa. Suzy has a pretend friend called "Leo Lion". Peppa cannot see Leo but Suzy announces that Leo likes roaring and he likes playing dressing up. Peppa decides that now she can see Leo.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmers personal hygiene leaves much to be desired. Shaun, Bitzer and the Flock decide action is needed - and set about giving the Farmer a full service wash.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When beavers cause a power cut in Pontypandy, Norman suggests keeping Dilyss frozen food cold outside, which turns out to be a very, very bad idea

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Out playing in the meadow, Holly, Ben and their friends find a broken toy robot. Holly fixes it with magic, but the robot does not behave as they thought it would, and soon it is trying to clean out the whole castle.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle has organised a Roller Disco for the children.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Inspired by Gemma and her mum smashing their personal best in the ocean, Neville takes on a challenge of his own - teaching his mum, Narelle, how to swim!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters chaotic restaurant takeover turns into a heartfelt lesson in teamwork and gratitude.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Star Birthday
programme.desc: When Nikhil and Jay hear Amma and Appa talking about a Star Birthday they try to find out what it is. Through misunderstanding they make it a Star Birthday to remember!

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie is at school for art class, learning about coming up with ideas and how to turn a mistake into a masterpiece.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: What makes a cloud rain? Alex is making a splash in the lab creating a colourful raincloud with food dye and shaving cream!

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The Alphablocks meet their match when the Brown Cow and her singing friends Owl, Howl and Growl take the stage. This episode introduces the OW letter team.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is International Day at playgroup and Peppa and her friends have dressed up as countries of the world.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie accidentally loses Bens toy car - that once belonged to his grandpa - shes determined to get it back!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley helps Hettie with a sleepover at the museum for Fred, Sophie, and Fifi. Before bedtime, they get to do a treasure hunt and search the whole museum for all the items on their activity sheets.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Newton is left powerless after Romeo discovers how to stop him re-energizing. If Newton hasnt got super powers, is he still a hero?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Inspired by Gemma and her mum smashing their personal best in the ocean, Neville takes on a challenge of his own - teaching his mum, Narelle, how to swim!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Gordon and Rebecca do the same work - but they go about it differently. When Rebecca tries to be more like Gordon, it doesnt go well... for Gordon!

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the junior gardeners brew some smelly grass tea for their lawn and a yummy native grass drink for themselves.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join Caterina and Henry the Octopus for a fun fitness adventure! Dance, tackle an obstacle course, and sing along to Do Your Ears Hang Low? Come join the Wiggly fun and lets get moving and grooving!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Cleo prepares her friends for the preschool potluck by teaching them manners in a game. Nervous but determined, the Super Monsters impress Cleos mom with their kindness and teamwork.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Rabbit comes to visit with a big tummy. Everyone is excited to find out there is a baby rabbit inside, but they are in for an even bigger surprise!

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Romeo invents a device that traps the PJM inside TV shows. Its the perfect plan, until he gets trapped inside too.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Its Mrs. Bird Day and Paddington wants to make a cake with a Special jar of Marmalade but no one can open it - how will he show his appreciation?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben, Holly and their friends go on a snail trek with Miss Jolly. The trek goes well until the snails head straight toward the Elf Farm and Mr Elfs cabbages...

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the kids create mini succulent cities from succulents and cacti complete with lights, little cars, dinosaurs and waterslides.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, Pepi Nana has her favourite jar and Mr Onion has his torch. Both come in very useful in Storyland, when everybody sets out on an adventure to rescue a little lost star.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: The Mollyvale talent show sees the villagers strut their stuff on stage. While Mort waits in the wings, he and Beep work to discover their talents and together they wow the crowd.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Jangos nap is disturbed by Zaps loud mail delivery whistle, so he secretly swaps it for a quieter one.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Mole and the Sound Collector listen to the sounds of an eclipse.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today Peppa and George are painting. Daddy shows Peppa and George how to mix paints and the three of them paint a beautiful picture of a cherry tree in the garden. Everything is going very well, until the ducks turn up!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When the Farmer pops out for more supplies, Bitzer is left in charge of decorating and calls on the Flock for help. He soon realises this may be a terrible mistake as they have their own way of doing things...

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea steals Tomatos precious jewel. Supertato ventures to get it back by secretly lifting the jewel from Evil Peas crown and defeating a crowd of rampaging Mini Peas.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Isadoras cousin Mirabelle magics up a Glitter Dragon for Bring Your Pet to School Day.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: Safety Fur All / Even Monsters Need Manners
programme.desc: Lobo learns rules ensure safety after a Ferris Wheel mishap, while Cleo teaches her friends manners at a potluck dinner, helping them impress her royal mom with kindness and respect.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds explore bridges! They watch a footbridge swing for a boat, a car bridge lift on pulleys, and a tall bridge rise straight up - supported by strong pillars beneath the water.

programme.title: The Gruffalos Child
programme.desc: Based on the best-selling childrens book this film tells the delightful tale of a little Gruffalo who ignores her fathers warnings and tiptoes out into the snow in search of the Big Bad Mouse.

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: Its bath time, and Maddie + Triggs embark on a bubble-tastic submarine adventure to the bottom of the ocean in search of Triggs favourite bath toy, Denis the Ducky.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.sub-title: Can We Have Our Ball Back
programme.desc: In this episode the Numberblocks learn to make 3D shapes using 2D shapes.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is raining outside so Peppa and George have to stay indoors. While they wait for the rain to stop, Daddy Pig teaches them a fun game.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Ben (aka Detective Deducer) finds a lost watch, he, Millie and Maya become detectives in order to return the watch to its rightful owner.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Fifi and Fred help Stanley clear the park after a storm so its ready for an Art Competition. They divide the rubbish into different bags, one for sticks, one for paper and one for leaves.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Pirate Robot wants to upgrade his ship stuff from the Flying Factory.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets build the Grand Crabby Hotel to protect rock pool sea creatures from the seagulls, but soon learn that despite being tough they shouldnt be moved.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Kenji hears that he must travel home to Japan alone, he gets scared and tries to hide. So, Thomas sets out to find him.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig brings some seeds for Peppa and George to grow a garden. Daddy Pig makes himself useful by being the scarecrow.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey, Bingo, Mum and Dad play a game of hand puppets, exploring the land beyond the Blue Mountains where they outsmart the Cheeky Fox to find the softest beds in the world.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar meet some wildebeest hanging out in a big group. The second animal they see, a monarch butterfly, has an astonishing wild connection with the wildebeest.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: The story of a brother and sister longing to carry out their dying mothers wish for them to find their brother, and a son whose life is on hold until his birthmother is a part of it.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A tasty sampler of stories from the land - covering food, agriculture, crops, climate, business and innovation - as we meet the fascinating people who make our rural and regional communities unique. Presented by Pip Courtney.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: While the unemployment rate is 4.2%, a decline in job ads is pointing to a labour market that is loosening. The RBA also expects an uptick in the jobless rate. The ABS today release unemployment figures for September.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: This week on The Pacific we look at Palaus feral monkey problem, and how Frances political turmoil is wreaking havoc half-way across the world. We also announce the winner of this years Pacific Break music competition.

programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Melissa Mackay brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas asks politicians the tough questions and talks to key players and experts on the issues driving the news cycle.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: This week on The Pacific we look at Palaus feral monkey problem, and how Frances political turmoil is wreaking havoc half-way across the world. We also announce the winner of this years Pacific Break music competition.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Chas and John bring you the latest on the Gaza ceasefire, the mass journalist walk-out at the Pentagon over the new reporting restrictions, plus do scandals really matter anymore to a candidates chances at election?

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Manny Tsigas presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Craig Smart.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan, James Glenday, Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy, Charles Brice and Nate Byrne hear from some of the guests who appeared on News Breakfast. Plus film critic Zak Hepburn and resident foodie Alice Zaslavsky.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Chas and John bring you the latest on the Gaza ceasefire, the mass journalist walk-out at the Pentagon over the new reporting restrictions, plus do scandals really matter anymore to a candidates chances at election?

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Alicia Barry presents a weekly roundup of business, finance and economic news including the latest trends on Australian and overseas markets, analysing whats going on in the local and global economy and how it affects you.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: In Ukraine, it is becoming increasingly difficult to care for the wounded on the frontlines. Plus 90 Italian inmates live on the prison island of Gorgona, so what are their lives like in the middle of the sea?

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Trumps involvement in the Gaza ceasefire deal coincides with the Nobel Peace Prize announcement. An Oz motoring journalist with a car marketing side hustle. Proposed FOI changes result in less freedom for less information.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you the days events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.
